critique: The document establishes the Air Medal and outlines the criteria for awarding it to members of the US armed forces. It focuses on meritorious achievement during aerial flight and delegates authority to the Secretaries of War, Navy, and Treasury to approve the design and regulations for the award. The order also specifies that only one medal can be awarded to a person, but additional achievements can be recognized with a bar or device. Posthumous awards can be presented to a representative of the deceased.The document does not express any clear political bias. It is a formal order establishing a military award and outlining the procedures for its distribution.
